title.narrative: OUTPUT 7: EBOLA - STRENGTHENED SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES AFFECTED

description.narrative: EBOLA - STRENGTHENED SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES AFFECTED, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The transmission of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in North Kivu and Ituri Provinces is interrupted and its spread to other provinces of the DRC and neighbouring countries, prevented

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EBOLA - STRENGTHENED SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES AFFECTED

description.narrative: The two Ebola resurgences in 2021 were quick to include Integrated Outbreak Analytics (IOA) provided by the Social Sciences Analytics Cell (CASS). This approach was one of the documented best practices from the 10th outbreak; and support outbreak response through 112 co-developed and actioned recommendations. The use of IOA meant that response strategies were developed based on previous evidence for a more accurate and effective response. In addition to using previous evidence, the 13th outbreak included an IOA cell to;again provide rapid, real time evidence to inform;outbreak response.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
